definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I pull her to pay, when, suddenly, I was reminded of the outside of the beggar.
sentences.chinese: 在我拉妈妈去付钱时，突然，我想起了外面的叫花子。

sentences.english: Why the beggar but a glasses of frame that street beg?
sentences.chinese: 为何街头行乞的叫花子却框个眼镜？

sentences.english: If thing could be obtained merely by wishing for them, poor people would be rich.
sentences.chinese: 如果梦想能自动实现，叫花子都能发财了。

sentences.english: It's very difficult for people to make friends directly with beggars.
sentences.chinese: 人们很难直接去结交一个叫花子。

sentences.english: This is a beggar sent it?
Beggars afterwards just know the tramp is the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 叫花子事后才知道这个流浪汉就是当今皇上。

definition: variant of 叫花子[jiao4 hua1 zi5]
(Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
soldier (from the two components of the 兵 character) (derog.)
